        He is riding on a donkey’s colt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At first Yeshua’s disciples didn’t know what these prophecies meant. However, when Yeshua was glorified, the disciples remembered that these prophecies had been written about him. The disciples remembered that they had taken part in fulfilling the prophecies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people who had been with Yeshua when he called Lazarus from the tomb and brought him back to life reported what they had seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because the crowd heard that Yeshua had performed this miracle, they came to meet him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees said to each other, “This is getting us nowhere. Look! The whole world is following him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some Greeks were among those who came to worship during the Passover festival.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went to Philip (who was from Bethsaida in Galilee) and told him, “Sir, we would like to meet Yeshua.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip told Andrew, and they told Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua replied to them, “The time has come for the Son of Man to be glorified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee this truth: A single grain of wheat doesn’t produce anything unless it is planted in the ground and dies. If it dies, it will produce a lot of grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who love their lives will destroy them, and those who hate their lives in this world will guard them for everlasting life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who serve me must follow me. My servants will be with me wherever I will be. If people serve me, the Father will honor them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am too deeply troubled now to know how to express my feelings. Should I say, ‘Father, save me from this time of suffering’? No! I came for this time of suffering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Father, give glory to your name.”
A voice from heaven said, “I have given it glory, and I will give it glory again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd standing there heard the voice and said that it had thundered. Others in the crowd said that an angel had talked to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua replied, “That voice wasn’t for my benefit but for yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This world is being judged now. The ruler of this world will be thrown out now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I have been lifted up from the earth, I will draw all people toward me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By saying this, he indicated how he was going to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd responded to him, “We have heard from the Scriptures that the Messiah will remain here forever. So how can you say, ‘The Son of Man must be lifted up from the earth’? Who is this ‘Son of Man’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua answered the crowd, “The light will still be with you for a little while. Walk while you have light so that darkness won’t defeat you. Those who walk in the dark don’t know where they’re going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
While you have the light, believe in the light so that you will become people whose lives show the light.”
After Yeshua had said this, he was concealed as he left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although they had seen Yeshua perform so many miracles, they wouldn’t believe in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In this way the words of the prophet Isaiah came true:
“Lord, who has believed our message?
    To whom has the Lord’s power been revealed?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people couldn’t believe because, as Isaiah also said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“God blinded them
    and made them close-minded
        so that their eyes don’t see
            and their minds don’t understand.
                And they never turn to me for healing!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isaiah said this because he had seen Yeshua’s glory and had spoken about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many rulers believed in Yeshua. However, they wouldn’t admit it publicly because the Pharisees would have thrown them out of the synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were more concerned about what people thought of them than about what God thought of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yeshua said loudly, “Whoever believes in me believes not only in me but also in the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever sees me sees the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the light that has come into the world so that everyone who believes in me will not live in the dark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone hears my words and doesn’t follow them, I don’t condemn them. I didn’t come to condemn the world but to save the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who reject me by not accepting what I say have a judge appointed for them. The words that I have spoken will judge them on the last day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have not spoken on my own. Instead, the Father who sent me told me what I should say and how I should say it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know that what he commands is eternal life. Whatever I say is what the Father told me to say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before the Passover festival, Yeshua knew that the time had come for him to leave this world and go back to the Father. Yeshua loved his own who were in the world, and he loved them to the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While supper was taking place, the devil had already put the idea of betraying Yeshua into the mind of Judas, son of Simon Iscariot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Father had put everything in Yeshua’s control. Yeshua knew that. He also knew that he had come from God and was going back to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he got up from the table, removed his outer clothes, took a towel, and tied it around his waist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he poured water into a basin and began to wash the disciples’ feet and dry them with the towel that he had tied around his waist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yeshua came to Simon Peter, Peter asked him, “Lord, are you going to wash my feet?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua answered Peter, “You don’t know now what I’m doing. You will understand later.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Peter told Yeshua, “You will never wash my feet.”
Yeshua replied to Peter, “If I don’t wash you, you don’t belong to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter said to Yeshua, “Lord, don’t wash only my feet. Wash my hands and my head too!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua told Peter, “People who have washed are completely clean. They need to have only their feet washed. All of you, except for one, are clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Yeshua knew who was going to betray him. That’s why he said, “All of you, except for one, are clean.”)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Yeshua had washed their feet and put on his outer clothes, he took his place at the table again. Then he asked his disciples, “Do you understand what I’ve done for you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You call me teacher and Lord, and you’re right because that’s what I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if I, your Lord and teacher, have washed your feet, you must wash each other’s feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ve given you an example that you should follow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee this truth: Slaves are not superior to their owners, and messengers are not superior to the people who send them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you understand all of this, you are blessed whenever you follow my example.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I’m not talking about all of you. I know the people I’ve chosen to be apostles. However, I’ve made my choice so that Scripture will come true. It says, ‘The one who eats my bread has turned against me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’m telling you now before it happens. Then, when it happens, you will believe that I am the one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I can guarantee this truth: Whoever accepts me accepts the one who sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After saying this, Yeshua was deeply troubled. He declared, “I can guarantee this truth: One of you is going to betray me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples began looking at each other and wondering which one of them Yeshua meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One disciple, the one whom Yeshua loved, was near him at the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter motioned to that disciple and said, “Ask Yeshua whom he’s talking about!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Leaning close to Yeshua, that disciple asked, “Lord, who is it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua answered, “He’s the one to whom I will give this piece of bread after I’ve dipped it in the sauce.” So Yeshua dipped the bread and gave it to Judas, son of Simon Iscariot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, after Judas took the piece of bread, Satan entered him. So Yeshua told him, “Hurry! Do what you have to do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one at the table knew why Yeshua said this to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas had the moneybag. So some thought that Yeshua was telling him to buy what they needed for the festival or to give something to the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas took the piece of bread and immediately went outside. It was night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Judas was gone, Yeshua said, “The Son of Man is now glorified, and because of him God is glorified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If God is glorified because of the Son of Man, God will glorify the Son of Man because of himself, and he will glorify the Son of Man at once.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said, “Dear children, I will still be with you for a little while. I’m telling you what I told the Jews. You will look for me, but you can’t go where I’m going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I’m giving you a new commandment: Love each other in the same way that I have loved you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone will know that you are my disciples because of your love for each other.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Simon Peter asked him, “Lord, where are you going?”
Yeshua answered him, “You can’t follow me now to the place where I’m going. However, you will follow me later.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to Yeshua, “Lord, why can’t I follow you now? I’ll give my life for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua replied, “Will you give your life for me? I can guarantee this truth: No rooster will crow until you say three times that you don’t know me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Don’t be troubled. Believe in God, and believe in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My Father’s house has many rooms. If that were not true, would I have told you that I’m going to prepare a place for you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I go to prepare a place for you, I will come again. Then I will bring you into my presence so that you will be where I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know the way to the place where I am going.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thomas said to him, “Lord, we don’t know where you’re going. So how can we know the way?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua answered him, “I am the way, the truth, and the life. No one goes to the Father except through me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you have known me, you will also know my Father. From now on you know him through me and have seen him in me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip said to Yeshua, “Lord, show us the Father, and that will satisfy us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua replied, “I have been with all of you for a long time. Don’t you know me yet, Philip? The person who has seen me has seen the Father. So how can you say, ‘Show us the Father’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t you believe that I am in the Father and the Father is in me? What I’m telling you doesn’t come from me. The Father, who lives in me, does what he wants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Believe me when I say that I am in the Father and that the Father is in me. Otherwise, believe me because of the things I do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I can guarantee this truth: Those who believe in me will do the things that I am doing. They will do even greater things because I am going to the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will do anything you ask the Father in my name so that the Father will be given glory because of the Son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you ask me to do something, I will do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you love me, you will obey my commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will ask the Father, and he will give you another helper who will be with you forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That helper is the Spirit of Truth. The world cannot accept him, because it doesn’t see or know him. You know him, because he lives with you and will be in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will not leave you all alone. I will come back to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In a little while the world will no longer see me, but you will see me. You will live because I live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day you will know that I am in my Father and that you are in me and that I am in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever knows and obeys my commandments is the person who loves me. Those who love me will have my Father’s love, and I, too, will love them and show myself to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas (not Iscariot) asked Yeshua, “Lord, what has happened that you are going to reveal yourself to us and not to the world?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua answered him, “Those who love me will do what I say. My Father will love them, and we will go to them and make our home with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A person who doesn’t love me doesn’t do what I say. I don’t make up what you hear me say. What I say comes from the Father who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have told you this while I’m still with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, the helper, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, will teach you everything. He will remind you of everything that I have ever told you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I’m leaving you peace. I’m giving you my peace. I don’t give you the kind of peace that the world gives. So don’t be troubled or cowardly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You heard me tell you, ‘I’m going away, but I’m coming back to you.’ If you loved me, you would be glad that I’m going to the Father, because the Father is greater than I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I’m telling you this now before it happens. When it does happen, you will believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ruler of this world has no power over me. But he’s coming, so I won’t talk with you much longer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, I want the world to know that I love the Father and that I am doing exactly what the Father has commanded me to do. Get up! We have to leave.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yeshua said, “I am the true vine, and my Father takes care of the vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He removes every one of my branches that doesn’t produce fruit. He also prunes every branch that does produce fruit to make it produce more fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are already clean because of what I have told you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Live in me, and I will live in you. A branch cannot produce any fruit by itself. It has to stay attached to the vine. In the same way, you cannot produce fruit unless you live in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the vine. You are the branches. Those who live in me while I live in them will produce a lot of fruit. But you can’t produce anything without me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever doesn’t live in me is thrown away like a branch and dries up. Branches like this are gathered, thrown into a fire, and burned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you live in me and what I say lives in you, then ask for anything you want, and it will be yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You give glory to my Father when you produce a lot of fruit and therefore show that you are my disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have loved you the same way the Father has loved me. So live in my love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you obey my commandments, you will live in my love. I have obeyed my Father’s commandments, and in that way I live in his love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have told you this so that you will be as joyful as I am, and your joy will be complete.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Love each other as I have loved you. This is what I’m commanding you to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The greatest love you can show is to give your life for your friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are my friends if you obey my commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I don’t call you servants anymore, because a servant doesn’t know what his master is doing. But I’ve called you friends because I’ve made known to you everything that I’ve heard from my Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You didn’t choose me, but I chose you. I have appointed you to go, to produce fruit that will last, and to ask the Father in my name to give you whatever you ask for.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Love each other. This is what I’m commanding you to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If the world hates you, realize that it hated me before it hated you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you had anything in common with the world, the world would love you as one of its own. But you don’t have anything in common with the world. I chose you from the world, and that’s why the world hates you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember what I told you: ‘A servant isn’t greater than his master.’ If they persecuted me, they will also persecute you. If they did what I said, they will also do what you say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, they will do all this to you because you are committed to me, since they don’t know the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I hadn’t come and spoken to them, they wouldn’t have any sin. But now they have no excuse for their sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who hates me also hates my Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I hadn’t done among them what no one else has done, they wouldn’t have any sin. But now they have seen and hated both me and my Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this way what is written in their Scriptures has come true: ‘They hate me for no reason.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The helper whom I will send to you from the Father will come. This helper, the Spirit of Truth who comes from the Father, will declare the truth about me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will declare the truth, too, because you have been with me from the beginning.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua continued, “I have said these things to you so that you won’t lose your faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be thrown out of synagogues. Certainly, the time is coming when people who murder you will think that they are serving God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will do these things to you because they haven’t known the Father or me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I’ve told you this so that when it happens you’ll remember what I’ve told you. I didn’t tell you this at first, because I was with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now I’m going to the one who sent me. Yet, none of you asks me where I’m going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But because I’ve told you this, you’re filled with sadness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, I am telling you the truth: It’s good for you that I’m going away. If I don’t go away, the helper won’t come to you. But if I go, I will send him to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will come to convict the world of sin, to show the world what has God’s approval, and to convince the world that God judges it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will convict the world of sin, because people don’t believe in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will show the world what has God’s approval, because I’m going to the Father and you won’t see me anymore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will convince the world that God judges it, because the ruler of this world has been judged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have a lot more to tell you, but that would be too much for you now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Spirit of Truth comes, he will guide you into the full truth. He won’t speak on his own. He will speak what he hears and will tell you about things to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will give me glory, because he will tell you what I say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everything the Father says is also what I say. That is why I said, ‘He will take what I say and tell it to you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “In a little while you won’t see me anymore. Then in a little while you will see me again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of his disciples said to each other, “What does he mean? He tells us that in a little while we won’t see him. Then he tells us that in a little while we will see him again and that he’s going to the Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they were asking each other, “What does he mean when he says, ‘In a little while’? We don’t understand what he’s talking about.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua knew they wanted to ask him something. So he said to them, “Are you trying to figure out among yourselves what I meant when I said, ‘In a little while you won’t see me, and in a little while you will see me again’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee this truth: You will cry because you are sad, but the world will be happy. You will feel pain, but your pain will turn to happiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A woman has pain when her time to give birth comes. But after the child is born, she doesn’t remember the pain anymore because she’s happy that a child has been brought into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now you’re in a painful situation. But I will see you again. Then you will be happy, and no one will take that happiness away from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When that day comes, you won’t ask me any more questions. I can guarantee this truth: If you ask the Father for anything in my name, he will give it to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So far you haven’t asked for anything in my name. Ask and you will receive so that you can be completely happy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have used examples to illustrate these things. The time is coming when I won’t use examples to speak to you. Rather, I will speak to you about the Father in plain words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When that day comes, you will ask for what you want in my name. I’m telling you that I won’t have to ask the Father for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Father loves you because you have loved me and have believed that I came from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I left the Father and came into the world. Again, as I’ve said, I’m going to leave the world and go back to the Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples said, “Now you’re talking in plain words and not using examples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now we know that you know everything. You don’t need to wait for questions to be asked. Because of this, we believe that you have come from God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua replied to them, “Now you believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The time is coming, and is already here, when all of you will be scattered. Each of you will go your own way and leave me all alone. Yet, I’m not all alone, because the Father is with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ve told you this so that my peace will be with you. In the world you’ll have trouble. But cheer up! I have overcome the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After saying this, Yeshua looked up to heaven and said, “Father, the time is here. Give your Son glory so that your Son can give you glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After all, you’ve given him authority over all humanity so that he can give eternal life to all those you gave to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is eternal life: to know you, the only true God, and Yeshua Christ, whom you sent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On earth I have given you glory by finishing the work you gave me to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, Father, give me glory in your presence with the glory I had with you before the world existed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I made your name known to the people you gave me. They are from this world. They belonged to you, and you gave them to me. They did what you told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now they know that everything you gave me comes from you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because I gave them the message that you gave me. They have accepted this message, and they know for sure that I came from you. They have believed that you sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I pray for them. I’m not praying for the world but for those you gave me, because they are yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everything I have is yours, and everything you have is mine. I have been given glory by the people you have given me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I won’t be in the world much longer, but they are in the world, and I’m coming back to you. Holy Father, keep them safe by the power of your name, the name that you gave me, so that their unity may be like ours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While I was with them, I kept them safe by the power of your name, the name that you gave me. I watched over them, and none of them, except one person, became lost. So Scripture came true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But now, Father, I’m coming back to you. I say these things while I’m still in the world so that they will have the same joy that I have.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have given them your message. But the world has hated them because they don’t belong to the world any more than I belong to the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’m not asking you to take them out of the world but to protect them from the evil one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They don’t belong to the world any more than I belong to the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Use the truth to make them holy. Your words are truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have sent them into the world the same way you sent me into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’m dedicating myself to this holy work I’m doing for them so that they, too, will use the truth to be holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I’m not praying only for them. I’m also praying for those who will believe in me through their message.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I pray that all of these people continue to have unity in the way that you, Father, are in me and I am in you. I pray that they may be united with us so that the world will believe that you have sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have given them the glory that you gave me. I did this so that they are united in the same way we are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am in them, and you are in me. So they are completely united. In this way the world knows that you have sent me and that you have loved them in the same way you have loved me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Father, I want those you have given to me to be with me, to be where I am. I want them to see my glory, which you gave me because you loved me before the world was made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Righteous Father, the world didn’t know you. Yet, I knew you, and these disciples have known that you sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have made your name known to them, and I will make it known so that the love you have for me will be in them and I will be in them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Yeshua finished his prayer, he went with his disciples to the other side of the Kidron Valley. They entered the garden that was there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas, who betrayed him, knew the place because Yeshua and his disciples often gathered there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Judas took a troop of soldiers and the guards from the chief priests and Pharisees and went to the garden. They were carrying lanterns, torches, and weapons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua knew everything that was going to happen to him. So he went to meet them and asked, “Who are you looking for?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They answered him, “Yeshua from Nazareth.”
Yeshua told them, “I am he.”
Judas, who betrayed him, was standing with the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yeshua told them, “I am he,” the crowd backed away and fell to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yeshua asked them again, “Who are you looking for?”
They said, “Yeshua from Nazareth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua replied, “I told you that I am he. So if you are looking for me, let these other men go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this way what Yeshua had said came true: “I lost none of those you gave me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter had a sword. He drew it, attacked the chief priest’s servant, and cut off the servant’s right ear. (The servant’s name was Malchus.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua told Peter, “Put your sword away. Shouldn’t I drink the cup of suffering that my Father has given me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the army officer and the Jewish guards arrested Yeshua. They tied Yeshua up
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and took him first to Annas, the father-in-law of Caiaphas. Caiaphas, the chief priest that year,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: was the person who had advised the Jews that it was better to have one man die for the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter and another disciple followed Yeshua. The other disciple was well-known to the chief priest. So that disciple went with Yeshua into the chief priest’s courtyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter, however, was standing outside the gate. The other disciple talked to the woman who was the gatekeeper and brought Peter into the courtyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The gatekeeper asked Peter, “Aren’t you one of this man’s disciples too?”
Peter answered, “No, I’m not!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servants and the guards were standing around a fire they had built and were warming themselves because it was cold. Peter was standing there, too, and warming himself with the others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priest questioned Yeshua about his disciples and his teachings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua answered him, “I have spoken publicly for everyone to hear. I have always taught in synagogues or in the temple courtyard, where all the Jews gather. I haven’t said anything in secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you question me? Question those who heard what I said to them. They know what I’ve said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yeshua said this, one of the guards standing near Yeshua slapped his face and said, “Is that how you answer the chief priest?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua replied to him, “If I’ve said anything wrong, tell me what it was. But if I’ve told the truth, why do you hit me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Annas sent Yeshua to Caiaphas, the chief priest. Yeshua was still tied up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Simon Peter continued to stand and warm himself by the fire. Some men asked him, “Aren’t you, too, one of his disciples?”
Peter denied it by saying, “No, I’m not!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the chief priest’s servants, a relative of the man whose ear Peter had cut off, asked him, “Didn’t I see you with Yeshua in the garden?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter again denied it, and just then a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Early in the morning, Yeshua was taken from Caiaphas’ house to the governor’s palace.
The Jews wouldn’t go into the palace. They didn’t want to become unclean, since they wanted to eat the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate came out to them and asked, “What accusation are you making against this man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews answered Pilate, “If he weren’t a criminal, we wouldn’t have handed him over to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate told the Jews, “Take him, and try him by your law.”
The Jews answered him, “We’re not allowed to execute anyone.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this way what Yeshua had predicted about how he would die came true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate went back into the palace, called for Yeshua, and asked him, “Are you the king of the Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua replied, “Did you think of that yourself, or did others tell you about me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate answered, “Am I a Jew? Your own people and the chief priests handed you over to me. What have you done?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua answered, “My kingdom doesn’t belong to this world. If my kingdom belonged to this world, my followers would fight to keep me from being handed over to the Jews. My kingdom doesn’t have its origin on earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate asked him, “So you are a king?”
Yeshua replied, “You’re correct in saying that I’m a king. I have been born and have come into the world for this reason: to testify to the truth. Everyone who belongs to the truth listens to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate said to him, “What is truth?”
After Pilate said this, he went out to the Jews again and told them, “I don’t find this man guilty of anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have a custom that I should free one person for you at Passover. Would you like me to free the king of the Jews for you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews shouted again, “Don’t free this man! Free Barabbas!” (Barabbas was a political revolutionary.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate had Yeshua taken away and whipped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers twisted some thorny branches into a crown, placed it on his head, and put a purple cape on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went up to him, said, “Long live the king of the Jews!” and slapped his face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate went outside again and told the Jews, “I’m bringing him out to you to let you know that I don’t find this man guilty of anything.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua went outside. He was wearing the crown of thorns and the purple cape. Pilate said to the Jews, “Look, here’s the man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the chief priests and the guards saw Yeshua, they shouted, “Crucify him! Crucify him!”
Pilate told them, “You take him and crucify him. I don’t find this man guilty of anything.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews answered Pilate, “We have a law, and by that law he must die because he claimed to be the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate heard them say that, he became more afraid than ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went into the palace again and asked Yeshua, “Where are you from?” But Yeshua didn’t answer him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate said to Yeshua, “Aren’t you going to answer me? Don’t you know that I have the authority to free you or to crucify you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua answered Pilate, “You wouldn’t have any authority over me if it hadn’t been given to you from above. That’s why the man who handed me over to you is guilty of a greater sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate heard what Yeshua said, he wanted to free him. But the Jews shouted, “If you free this man, you’re not a friend of the emperor. Anyone who claims to be a king is defying the emperor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate heard what they said, he took Yeshua outside and sat on the judge’s seat in a place called Stone Pavement. (In Hebrew it is called Gabbatha.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The time was about six o’clock in the morning on the Friday of the Passover festival.
Pilate said to the Jews, “Look, here’s your king!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Jews shouted, “Kill him! Kill him! Crucify him!”
Pilate asked them, “Should I crucify your king?”
The chief priests responded, “The emperor is the only king we have!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Pilate handed Yeshua over to them to be crucified.
So the soldiers took Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He carried his own cross and went out of the city to a location called The Skull. (In Hebrew this place is called Golgotha.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers crucified Yeshua and two other men there. Yeshua was in the middle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate wrote a notice and put it on the cross. The notice read, “Yeshua from Nazareth, the king of the Jews.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many Jews read this notice, because the place where Yeshua was crucified was near the city. The notice was written in Hebrew, Latin, and Greek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests of the Jewish people told Pilate, “Don’t write, ‘The king of the Jews!’ Instead, write, ‘He said that he is the king of the Jews.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate replied, “I have written what I’ve written.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the soldiers had crucified Yeshua, they took his clothes and divided them four ways so that each soldier could have a share. His robe was left over. It didn’t have a seam because it had been woven in one piece from top to bottom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers said to each other, “Let’s not rip it apart. Let’s throw dice to see who will get it.” In this way the Scripture came true: “They divided my clothes among themselves. They threw dice for my clothing.” So that’s what the soldiers did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua’s mother, her sister, Mary (the wife of Clopas), and Mary from Magdala were standing beside Yeshua’s cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua saw his mother and the disciple whom he loved standing there. He said to his mother, “Look, here’s your son!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he said to the disciple, “Look, here’s your mother!”
From that time on she lived with that disciple in his home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, when Yeshua knew that everything had now been finished, he said, “I’m thirsty.” He said this so that Scripture could finally be concluded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A jar filled with vinegar was there. So the soldiers put a sponge soaked in the vinegar on a hyssop stick and held it to his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
After Yeshua had taken the vinegar, he said, “It is finished!”
Then he bowed his head and died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since it was Friday and the next day was an especially important day of worship, the Jews didn’t want the bodies to stay on the crosses. So they asked Pilate to have the men’s legs broken and their bodies removed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers broke the legs of the first man and then of the other man who had been crucified with Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the soldiers came to Yeshua and saw that he was already dead, they didn’t break his legs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, one of the soldiers stabbed Yeshua’s side with his spear, and blood and water immediately came out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who saw this is an eyewitness. What he says is true, and he knows that he is telling the truth so that you, too, will believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This happened so that the Scripture would come true: “None of his bones will be broken.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another Scripture passage says, “They will look at the person whom they have stabbed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later Joseph from the city of Arimathea asked Pilate to let him remove Yeshua’s body. (Joseph was a disciple of Yeshua but secretly because he was afraid of the Jews). Pilate gave him permission to remove Yeshua’s body. So Joseph removed it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nicodemus, the one who had first come to Yeshua at night, went with Joseph and brought 75 pounds of a myrrh and aloe mixture.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These two men took the body of Yeshua and bound it with strips of linen. They laced the strips with spices. This was the Jewish custom for burial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A garden was located in the place where Yeshua was crucified. In that garden was a new tomb in which no one had yet been placed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph and Nicodemus put Yeshua in that tomb, since that day was the Jewish day of preparation and since the tomb was nearby.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Early on Sunday morning, while it was still dark, Mary from Magdala went to the tomb. She saw that the stone had been removed from the tomb’s entrance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she ran to Simon Peter and the other disciple, whom Yeshua loved. She told them, “They have removed the Lord from the tomb, and we don’t know where they’ve put him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Peter and the other disciple headed for the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The two were running side by side, but the other disciple ran faster than Peter and came to the tomb first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He bent over and looked inside the tomb. He saw the strips of linen lying there but didn’t go inside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter arrived after him and went into the tomb. He saw the strips of linen lying there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also saw the cloth that had been on Yeshua’s head. It wasn’t lying with the strips of linen but was rolled up separately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the other disciple, who arrived at the tomb first, went inside. He saw and believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They didn’t know yet what Scripture meant when it said that Yeshua had to come back to life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the disciples went back home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary, however, stood there and cried as she looked at the tomb. As she cried, she bent over and looked inside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She saw two angels in white clothes. They were sitting where the body of Yeshua had been lying. One angel was where Yeshua’s head had been, and the other was where his feet had been.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The angels asked her why she was crying.
Mary told them, “They have removed my Lord, and I don’t know where they’ve put him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After she said this, she turned around and saw Yeshua standing there. However, she didn’t know that it was Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yeshua asked her, “Why are you crying? Who are you looking for?”
Mary thought it was the gardener speaking to her. So she said to him, “Sir, if you carried him away, tell me where you have put him, and I’ll remove him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yeshua said to her, “Mary!”
Mary turned around and said to him in Hebrew, “Rabboni!” (This word means “teacher.”)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua told her, “Don’t hold on to me. I have not yet gone to the Father. But go to my brothers and sisters and tell them, ‘I am going to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary from Magdala went to the disciples and told them, “I have seen the Lord.” She also told them what he had said to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That Sunday evening, the disciples were together behind locked doors because they were afraid of the Jews. Yeshua stood among them and said to them, “Peace be with you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he said this, he showed them his hands and his side. The disciples were glad to see the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to them again, “Peace be with you! As the Father has sent me, so I am sending you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he had said this, he breathed on the disciples and said, “Receive the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever you forgive sins, they are forgiven. Whenever you don’t forgive them, they are not forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thomas, one of the twelve apostles, who was called Didymus, wasn’t with them when Yeshua came.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The other disciples told him, “We’ve seen the Lord.”
Thomas told them, “I refuse to believe this unless I see the nail marks in his hands, put my fingers into them, and put my hand into his side.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A week later Yeshua’s disciples were again in the house, and Thomas was with them. Even though the doors were locked, Yeshua stood among them and said, “Peace be with you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yeshua said to Thomas, “Put your finger here, and look at my hands. Take your hand, and put it into my side. Stop doubting, and believe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thomas responded to Yeshua, “My Lord and my God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to Thomas, “You believe because you’ve seen me. Blessed are those who haven’t seen me but believe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua performed many other miracles that his disciples saw. Those miracles are not written in this book.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But these miracles have been written so that you will believe that Yeshua is the Messiah, the Son of God, and so that you will have life by believing in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, by the Sea of Tiberias, Yeshua showed himself again to the disciples. This is what happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter, Thomas (called Didymus), Nathanael from Cana in Galilee, Zebedee’s sons, and two other disciples of Yeshua were together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Simon Peter said to the others, “I’m going fishing.”
They told him, “We’re going with you.”
They went out in a boat but didn’t catch a thing that night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the sun was rising, Yeshua stood on the shore. The disciples didn’t realize that it was Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yeshua asked them, “Friends, haven’t you caught any fish?”
They answered him, “No, we haven’t.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “Throw the net out on the right side of the boat, and you’ll catch some.” So they threw the net out and were unable to pull it in because so many fish were in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciple whom Yeshua loved said to Peter, “It’s the Lord.” When Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he put back on the clothes that he had taken off and jumped into the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The other disciples came with the boat and dragged the net full of fish. They weren’t far from the shore, only about 100 yards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they went ashore, they saw a fire with a fish lying on the coals, and they saw a loaf of bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua told them, “Bring some of the fish you’ve just caught.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter got into the boat and pulled the net ashore. Though the net was filled with 153 large fish, it was not torn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua told them, “Come, have breakfast.” None of the disciples dared to ask him who he was. They knew he was the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua took the bread, gave it to them, and did the same with the fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the third time that Yeshua showed himself to the disciples after he had come back to life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
After they had eaten breakfast, Yeshua asked Simon Peter, “Simon, son of John, do you love me more than the other disciples do?”
Peter answered him, “Yes, Lord, you know that I love you.”
Yeshua told him, “Feed my lambs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yeshua asked him again, a second time, “Simon, son of John, do you love me?”
Peter answered him, “Yes, Lord, you know that I love you.”
Yeshua told him, “Take care of my sheep.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yeshua asked him a third time, “Simon, son of John, do you love me?”
Peter felt sad because Yeshua had asked him a third time, “Do you love me?” So Peter said to him, “Lord, you know everything. You know that I love you.”
Yeshua told him, “Feed my sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee this truth: When you were young, you would get ready to go where you wanted. But when you’re old, you will stretch out your hands, and someone else will get you ready to take you where you don’t want to go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said this to show by what kind of death Peter would bring glory to God. After saying this, Yeshua told Peter, “Follow me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter turned around and saw the disciple whom Yeshua loved. That disciple was following them. He was the one who leaned against Yeshua’s chest at the supper and asked, “Lord, who is going to betray you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Peter saw him, he asked Yeshua, “Lord, what about him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to Peter, “If I want him to live until I come again, how does that concern you? Follow me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So a rumor that that disciple wouldn’t die spread among Yeshua’s followers. But Yeshua didn’t say that he wouldn’t die. What Yeshua said was, “If I want him to live until I come again, how does that concern you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This disciple was an eyewitness of these things and wrote them down. We know that what he says is true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua also did many other things. If every one of them were written down, I suppose the world wouldn’t have enough room for the books that would be written.
verses.speaker: Narrator
